name: canvas-design
description: Create beautiful visual art in .png and .pdf documents using design philosophy. You should use this skill when the user asks to create a poster, piece of art, design, or other static piece. Create original visual designs, never copying existing artists' work to avoid copyright violations.

design_request.description: The user's request for what to create (e.g., 'create a poster for a jazz festival', 'design art for a meditation app', 'make a visual piece about urban architecture')

subtle_reference.description: Optional subtle conceptual thread or niche reference to embed within the art (e.g., a cultural reference, theme, or subject matter that should influence the design subtly)

output_format.description: Preferred output format for the visual design

number_of_pages.description: Number of pages/designs to create (for multi-page projects like coffee table books)

color_palette_preference.description: Optional color palette guidance (e.g., 'monochromatic', 'earth tones', 'vibrant primary colors')

aesthetic_direction.description: Optional aesthetic hints or style preferences (e.g., 'brutalist', 'minimalist', 'organic', 'geometric')

text_content.description: Optional minimal text to include in the design (title, key phrases, labels). Should be sparse and integrated as visual elements

movement_name.description: The 1-2 word name of the created aesthetic movement (e.g., 'Brutalist Joy', 'Chromatic Silence')

philosophy_content.description: The complete 4-6 paragraph design philosophy describing visual expression, spatial communication, and aesthetic principles

file_path.description: Path to the .md file containing the design philosophy
Path to the .png or .pdf file containing the visual design

visual_artifacts.description: Array of visual design files created (one or more pages)

deduced_reference.description: The subtle conceptual thread or niche reference that was embedded within the art

fonts_used.description: List of font names used in the design

color_palette.description: Primary colors used in the design (hex codes)

craftsmanship_notes.description: Notes on the expert-level craftsmanship techniques applied and refinements made
